actions.committee: Senate Committee on District of Columbia
actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on District of Columbia.

official_title: A bill to facilitate the administration of the laws in the District of Columbia with respect to the levying and collecting of certain taxes.

summary.text: Provides that unless a money or surety bond is posted no permit shall be issued for the use of federally owned real property within the District of Columbia for camping, sleeping, or sitting, or for a march, demonstration, or parade, or for the erection of any structure, where: (1) the issuing employee or officer believes damage may occur, or (2) he believes police or Federal forces will incur expenses otherwise not normally incurred. Allows the issuing employee to require the applicant to have and use a reasonable means of identifying all persons desiring to use such property. Provides that whoever without first posting such bond as required under this Act uses any real property in the District of Columbia shall be fined not more than $100 or imprisoned not more than 60 days, or both; and that if the property is occupied overnight there shall be a fine of not more than $500 or imprisonment for not longer than 90 days, or both.

titles.title: A bill to facilitate the administration of the laws in the District of Columbia with respect to the levying and collecting of certain taxes.
